title: Wally Downes handed £3,000 fine and suspended from all football-related activity for 28 days
text:
Wimbledon manager Wally Downes has been suspended from all football and football-related activity for 28 days and handed a £3,000 fine, after admitting breaching FA Betting rules.

Sportsmail understands Wimbledon are now preparing to axe Downes, with his assistant Glyn Hodges set to take over.

Downes placed five bets on football matches between 30 November 2013 and 30 January 2014, and three bets between 16 March 2019 and 12 July 2019.

The Dons suspended Downes in September after he was charged with over betting irregularities by the Football Association.

Wally Downes is facing the sack by AFC Wimbledon after admitting to breaching betting rules

The League One club are now said to be considering his future due to the length of the ban.

Downes has already missed four games due to the club's suspension and will now miss eight in total following FA's ban on Friday morning.

Downes, 58, a much-travelled coach, has been in charge at the Cherry Red Records Stadium since December 2018.

Wimbledon are currently sitting in the relegation zone in League One.
